pr_title: Add note about different JDBC drivers x native

timeline.message: Add note about different JDBC drivers x native

timeline.bodyText: I would s/when possible/if you plan to compile your application as a native executable/.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,13 @@ For instance, when we have a JDBC driver extension for a given kind,
 we resolve the JDBC driver to be used automatically, so you don't need to configure it yourself.
 If you want to use a database kind that is not part of this list, just use `other` or whatever name you prefer.
 
+[NOTE]
+====
+Although it's possible to use any other JDBC driver in JVM mode, it's highly unlikely that it will work when compiling your application to native.
+
+We recommend you to use the existing JDBC Quarkus extensions when possible.

replies.bodyText: As for the why: you don't have a choice. You have a database, you need to connect to it. You won't migrate your Oracle database to PostgreSQL if you want to give Quarkus a try. So we need to be very careful about how we are wording things.
replies.author: gsmet
